revised_title: Experiments on Fog-Signals and the Comparison of Gunpowder and Gun-Cotton
tldr: Dr. Tyndall investigates the effectiveness of various explosive materials, such as gunpowder and gun-cotton, in producing loud sounds for fog signals. He concludes that gun-cotton, due to its rapid combustion, is a more effective sound-producer than gunpowder, and suggests its use in fog signals for better communication in dense weather conditions.
